result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher C Rayford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Upon successful completion of probation and payment of all fines and court costs, defendant to petition the Court for expungment.
DNA sample unless already done.  Court is not opposed to the transfer of the Probation to Dan eCounty where the deft resides.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher C Rayford

Defendant Christopher C Rayford in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearance given. Charge is amended to 947.01(1) Disorderly Conduct.  Deft enters a plea of guilty to the charge.   Plea questionnaire reviewed. Clerk directed to enter plea. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas & finds guilty.

Court orders:
12 months probation w/held sentence - not opposed to transfer to Dane County
  Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.
90 days jail  w/huber - STAYED for rule violation
$98.37  Service and process fee
  DNA sample unless already done.
  Upon successful completion of probation and payment of all fines and court costs, defendant to petition the Court for expungment.
0 sentence credit

Attorney Jessica L Schuster appeared.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Defense requests an adjournment do to the weather in the southern part of the State.  The State does not object.  Court grants the adjournment. New date set.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 31, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Jessica L Schuster appeared.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Victim was given notice of this hearing but does not apperance.   Court did a in-camera review of the documents regarding the leave of the victim.  Court did redeact information.  Court gives the original and a redeacted copy to file and seal.  Copies were also given to State and Defense. 

Court excuses the deft appearance by statements made by the defense the deft is currently in the Dane County Jail.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for September 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher C Rayford in court by phone with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Victim rights have been complied with. Court to give oral ruling re Motion to compel.  Only involves administrative leave in regards to this incident. Court grants the motion. State makes a motion for a camera review. Court feels that they need to review the report before going to the defense.  State will also contact the victim to let them know the ruling and see if and how they want to proceed.
